intro: Blakea hirsutissima var. glandulifera, commonly known as the glandular Blakea, is a species native to the tropical regions of South America. It is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family, characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in humid, shaded environments. Its leaves are usually hairy and glandular, giving it a distinctive appearance. The flowers, which can be yellow or red, attract a variety of pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
